Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a gRPC server in Go that provides a simple key-value store service with various RPC methods for setting, getting, and streaming items.

Struct Description: The intStoreServer struct implements a gRPC server for a key-value store service, handling item storage and retrieval operations through different RPC patterns (unary, server streaming, client streaming, and bidirectional streaming).

Fields:
Addr: string - The network address where the server is listening
l: net.Listener - The network listener for incoming connections
gsrv: *grpc.Server - The gRPC server instance
items: map[string]int32 - The internal storage for key-value pairs

Methods:
newIntStoreServer: () -> *intStoreServer - Creates and starts a new server instance on an available port
stop: () -> () - Gracefully shuts down the server
Set: (context.Context, *pb.Item) -> (*pb.SetResponse, error) - Unary RPC to set a key-value pair
setItem: (*pb.Item) -> int32 - Internal helper method to store an item
Get: (context.Context, *pb.GetRequest) -> (*pb.Item, error) - Unary RPC to retrieve a value by key
ListItems: (*pb.ListItemsRequest, pb.IntStore_ListItemsServer) -> error - Server streaming RPC to list items matching criteria
SetStream: (pb.IntStore_SetStreamServer) -> error - Client streaming RPC to set multiple items
StreamChat: (pb.IntStore_StreamChatServer) -> error - Bidirectional streaming RPC for chat-like communication
